attributes.action: Allow HM Armed forces to be able to vote at their current base UK or worldwide.
attributes.background: Due to the busy and unpredictable nature of their jobs Service personnel have found it difficult to vote in person or by post/proxy and often don't get to have their say on matters and the things that ultimately effect their careers, families and their country they are proud to serve.

attributes.action: For ALL EU Protected Sites & Species to carry on being so even if not in the EU
attributes.background: We have various species and sites in the UK that are currently protected by EU law.  We must ensure that these continue to be protected within the UK even if we are no longer part of the European Union due to the result of the recent democratic vote.
attributes.additional_details:
A few links to various species and sites that are currently protected: 
http://jncc.defra.gov.uk/page-1747
https://www.gov.uk/topic/environmental-management/wildlife-habitat-conservation

attributes.action: Brexit negotiations to promote a strong & collaborative relationship with the EU
attributes.background: Sixteen million people voted to Remain. The views of these people and the weight of their opinion must be reflected in Brexit negotiations. The negotiation team must focus on forging a strong, collaborative and balanced working relationship with the EU, and be made up accordingly.
attributes.additional_details:
I was vehemently for Remain, and now I am determined that Brexit is made to mean healthy collaboration with the EU on new terms (and terms that the Northern Ireland and Scotland can support as part of the UK) rather than a soapbox for nationalistic rhetoric!

Britain may have voted out, but it clearly and emphatically does not want away. Most importantly, Brexit does not (and will not) mean embracing the Farage and Le Pen view of the world!

It is hope the EU will help us make this happen.

attributes.action: Put Food Technology back on the A and AS level options.
attributes.background: My friend wants to become a chef when she graduates university, however without an A level course in Food Technology she feels as though other older candidates, who had the option of this course, will be better prepared for the job, therefore more likely to be hired.

attributes.action: Only allow people who have served in the British Armed forces to vote.
attributes.background: Someone who has served their country and have been prepared to lay down their life should be allowed to vote. Therefore it should be a requirement that a person serves a minimum of 3 years in the armed forces to be eligible to vote in an election or referendum.

attributes.action: Make feeding owned cats a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Sign this petition to help get the law changed on feeding owned cats. 
Feeding someone else's cat can cause them to leave home, causing stress and upset to the beloved cats owners/family. 
At present the police/rspca/cats protection will not help, as there is no law on feeding another persons cat.

attributes.action: Define rights of EU citizens currently living in Britain after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
There are many EU citizens who have been living and working in Britain for many years, and built lives here

Once Clause 50 is enacted, nothing will definite their status.
However, the British Parliament can define immediately what rights these people have once we are no longer in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Some EU citizens have lived here for decades, worked, paid taxes, and contributed to the British Economy.
No timeline has been given by Parliament to start, and it can take up to two years to complete
It is unfair to expect tax paying people to endure this period of uncertainty in their lives.  This decision does not need to wait for EU negotiations to begin, or await a new prime minister – it can be enacted with immediate effect, as this right will be the responsibility of the British People

attributes.action: Create a multi-party team to negotiate the exit from the EU including MYPs
attributes.background: The exit from the EU has a long term impact. MYPs (youth parliamentarians) should be included in a new multi party team that leads the exit rather than the leader of the largest party in Westminster. This team needs to reflect the views and background of the nation as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: There are 12 different political parties with MPs in Westminster. There are 369 MYPs. The young have the most to lose from a poorly negotiated exit. Let's ensure a democratically representative task force, including all parties and elected young people leads the exit process. This will avoid the exit being led by a team with an unrepresentative perspective on what we in the UK want. This gives us a chance at getting the democracy in the UK that we deserve.

attributes.action: Give young people of 13 years and over the right to vote in referenda.
attributes.background: I am 13.  People of my age will have to live with the decisions that adults made for us for years to come.  We need a say.  Young people are just as engaged as adults.  We have access to social media and information, and we take it in.  We want to secure our own futures.

attributes.action: European Union Referendum, 75% Required
attributes.background: Call upon HM Government to implement a rule that if the Remain or Leave vote is less than 75% then the Referendum Vote to Remain or to Leave the European Union is conducted again, until we reach 3/4 of the United Kingdom agreeing to either Remain or to Leave the European Union.

attributes.action: Raise the age of voting to 25
attributes.background: It would appear that too many young people between the ages of 18 and 25 are being persuaded about their political decisions by uneducated pop stars and celebrities. therefore only persons over 25 should have the political mandate.
attributes.additional_details:
Bob Geldorf, had a few hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

Bono, had some hit records and now extols the advantages of remaining in the EU. With no expertise in how the EU works or any political office of his own. is also not a British citizen

attributes.action: Let Bristol & London remain in the EU following a majority in the referendum
attributes.background: Following on from the EU referendum, Bristol & London both had an overwhelming majority vote to remain with Bristol at 62% & London at 73.5%. They should therefore be allowed to remain in the EU governed as separate county states by local government.

attributes.action: Make a second EU referendum not up for debate for four years.
attributes.background:
The humans of the United Kingdom won a Democratic Vote to LEAVE the European Union. 

Please ensure by a legally binding contract all referendums on the same political-economical topic have four year gaps. We cannot have a second European Union referendum this close to the first.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Respect for moralistic democracy 
2. Post-pone second referendum for 4 years
3. Over-rule petition for second European Union referendum that is desired for this year.

attributes.action: A referendum to decide whether Norwich should become an independent nation.
attributes.background: After the result of the European Referendum, particularly the result in Norwich, we believe that Norwich has the infrastructure to become an independent nation, separate from the UK. After years of neglect from Westminster, Norwich has a better chance of growth if we leave the UK.

attributes.action: Allow the area within the M25 to secede from the UK and remain part of the EU.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe the results of the EU referendum highlight irreconcilable differences between those living within the M25 and those outside of it.  Accordingly, we wish to secede from the UK so that we can have our (sane) vote to remain part of the EU respected.
attributes.additional_details: We invite those areas of the UK that voted to remain to join us and become part of a new commonwealth of the enlightened.

attributes.action: Explore further concessions to remain within the EU
attributes.background: We propose that the government explore all possibilities of gaining further concessions from the EU in order that the UK might remain a member nation. The ramifications of leaving the EU will be devastating for the continent as a whole. All options need to be explored prior to closing the door.
attributes.additional_details:
It is evident that the UK's current relationship with the EU was rejected by a very slim margin and it is important that this rejection is respected. However due to the size of the margin and a previous offer of further concessions from it would be undemocratic not to explore all available options as long as there is sufficient support for this petition. 

We owe it to future generations to explore all options before we inflict such a profound socioeconomic change on the UK and the EU.

attributes.action: Don't Hold a General Election on account of result of EU Referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has now entered a period of unparalleled uncertainty and this uncertainty is the biggest threat to continuing UK financial stability. 
Financial markets are already unsettled as it is, and a General Election would prolong the uncertainty and economic fallout of Brexit, at everyone's expense.
attributes.additional_details: Uncertainty over the outcome of the EU Referendum already had a significant impact on the UK economy prior to this vote, with foreign direct investment being put on hold as well as stock markets and sterling becoming increasingly volatile. Now a vote to leave has prolonged this period of uncertainty and is likely to have a significant short term economic impact. It is vital that a General Election is not called to ensure that the financial fallout of Brexit is not prolonged for UK households.

attributes.action: Create an independent City State of London & the surrounding areas.
attributes.background: Due to the recent European Referendum result, it's apparent that London has a significantly different outlook in regards to the rest of the world. We therefore wish for London to break away from the UK and become an independent, sovereign nation.

attributes.action: A vote of no confidence in the Prime Minister & the Chancellor of the Exchequer.
attributes.background:
Many electorate find the PM's behaviour & that of the Chancellor in the EU Referendum run up well below the standards expected of holders of high office.

Speculation, "Project Fear" & blackmail threats of raising taxes if we vote leave fall below what ordinary people require of their leaders.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for workers in dog shelters to kill unwanted dogs.
attributes.background: In dog shelters, workers kill unwanted dogs after a certain amount of time, which can be up to a week which doesn't give the dog a chance to live in a happy home where it is wanted. Dogs have feelings too, dogs are a man's best friend!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dogwatchuk.com/death-row-dogs/
attributes.creator_name: Fiona Grezda, Jasmine Murphy, Alma Roe

attributes.action: Enforce stricter banking regulations for online gambling transactions.
attributes.background: Many online gaming companies offer a self-exclusion service as part of responsible gambling. However, due to the large variety of online gambling sites, it is very easy for problem gamblers to relapse. We want banks to offer a similar self-exclusion service for such transactions being made.
attributes.additional_details: Our suggestions are for a self-exclusion based service being made available by banks to offer a more rigid deterrent to online gambling addicts from which is currently available. We'd also like to see stricter regulations in normal online transactions being made to gambling sites; and question marks being made where large sums are being deposited to help deter online gambling and aid those with addictions or potential addictions to gaming.

attributes.action: Raise a vote on no confidence in the Chancellor
attributes.background:
In the run up to the EU Referendum the Chancellor has acted in an irresponsible manner.

This petition is to raise a vote on no confidence on behalf of the public whom he represents. His behaviour is irresponsible and is misleading the British public.

attributes.action: Hand the same £100 on the spot fine to cyclists without a helmet.
attributes.background: Motorists are given an on the spot fine for not wearing a seatbelt.  There is no reason this should not be imposed upon a cyclist on a cycle without head protection.
attributes.additional_details: There are already many changes in cyclists favour. Prioritised junctions, Left turn bans, Stricter lgv regulations, mirrors at junctions, but still day after day they dart around without safety equipment. More responsibility should be put on them.

attributes.action: Call on UEFA to ban & send Russian Fans home after violence against England fans
attributes.background: We clearly see evidence of Russian fans attacking England supporters. We believe that violence has no place in football. We're fed up of being highlighted as trouble makers. UEFA should send Russian fans home for their poor display towards other human beings to which the ECHR holds dear.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/HooligansTVi/videos/593950987452298/

attributes.action: Introduce retrospective legislation offering protection to company pension funds
attributes.background: Philip Green purchased BHS in 2000. Since then he has reportedly extracted £580M from the company, driving it to bankruptcy. Meanwhile there is a £571M shortfall in the pension fund affecting thousands of workers. This is a morally reprehensible situation that should be rectified.

attributes.action: Lower £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable to the citizens.
attributes.background:
Lower the £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable for the citizens.

* Young adults marrying abroad
• Hard to earn atleast £350 a week
• Taxes have increased significantly
• Work 5 days Monday - Friday after tax come out with £250. 
• Overtime pay should not be taxed
attributes.additional_details:
Lower the £18,600 to apply for a spouse visa or make it affordable for the citizens.

* Young adults marrying abroad
• Hard to earn atleast £350 a week
• Taxes have increased significantly
• Work 5 days Monday - Friday after tax come out with £250. 
• Overtime pay should not be taxed
• Work 7 days to earn the £350 a week no social life or time spent with family friends.
• Increase pay, reduce taxes or decrease the £18,600
• Work stress free with the weekend to your own self
• Let citizens live!

attributes.action: Send aid and health trained volunteers into Aleppo to help with current crisis.
attributes.background: Aleppo deserves help, we have already turned our backs once before by making it clear England doesn't want refugees, bombing needs to stop. There is no hospitals left. It's a human rights violation. send them aid- medicine, shelter, food, drink, clothes and volunteers trained in health care
attributes.additional_details: Every single day people are dying in Aleppo. Watch the news

attributes.action: hold referendum on ending public financing of the royal family.
attributes.background: redecorating Buckingham palace will cost the taxpayer 367 million pounds, why isn't this very wealthy family responsible for the maintenance of the properties they live in? A referendum should be held for us to decide if they should continue to receive any finance from British taxpayers.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all new parents to learn CPR before leaving maternity unit
attributes.background: Any new parent should be taught CPR and basic life support skills before leaving the maternity into with their newborn child. This should include choking, unconsciousness, CPR to help increase chance of survival if the unimaginable happens.

attributes.action: Make the weekend a THREE day period rather than two.
attributes.background:
Do you feel Weekend is too short, there's not enough time to complete tasks and spend time with family.

Sign this petition to take action on making weekend a THREE day period rather than the current two day weekend.

attributes.action: Review funding into public services. Local authorities, NHS,police etc need help
attributes.background: Working in the public sector I have seen a decline in the last few years and knowing what future budgets hold I fear for communities. Had funding been correct over the years then there wouldn't be issues such as complaints on GP access or lack of bin collections etc
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence here is qualitative:
We all know someone who:

* Has struggled to see a doctor 
* Is homeless or can't get housing 
* Parents who scramble each year for a decent school place
* who is struggling to afford to eat
* works too many hours because they can't afford childcare 
* damaged a tyre due to pot holes in roads 
* Lack of landscaping 
* crime not responded too

attributes.action: Provide New Zealand with aid to help them rebuild after the earthquake.
attributes.background: In light of the two earthquakes that have just hit the New Zealand south island on 13th Nov, the British Government should provide aid to assist the government and people of New Zealand to rebuild their infrastructure. The money should come from the overseas aid budget

attributes.action: Petition to make Dementia Awareness a mandatory subject in citizenship
attributes.background: I currently work in a dementia and complex needs hospital for the mental health service in the east of England. As we are aware, mental health has a stigma; and many don't realise dementia does too! Basic dementia awareness is not known to the general public. This needs to change and quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Dementia is an umbrella term for a range of cognitive impairments, that progressively get worse over time.
According to Alzheimer's Society - "There are 850,000 people with dementia in the UK, with numbers set to rise to over 1 million by 2025. 225,000 will develop dementia this yea; that’s one every three minutes!" And most shockingly "There are over 40,000 people under 65 with dementia in the UK".

Yet, many people do not have basic understanding of the signs and symptoms for Dementia.

attributes.action: Private companies must allow 10 minutes before issue of a parking invoice.
attributes.background: Many retail parks, housing developments and busimesses use private parking companies to control parking in their carparks or roads. We believe these companies should be legally required to allow the driver to overstay by a maximum of ten minutes, just as traffic wardens and council wardens have to.
attributes.additional_details: If you are held up at the till because there are not enough staff at the checkouts, is it fair to be charged by the parking company that the store employs? Is it right to receive a ticket because you pulled up at your door to unload shopping before taking your car to the official car park? No, it isn't. These charges are exhorbitant and unfair. They should have to allow at least a few minutes grace before pouncing and issuing a fine.

attributes.action: Pass a law that does what the Children & Young Persons Act 1933 is meant to do.
attributes.background: The Children & Young Persons Act 1933 says it is illegal for a child who is younger than 13, to assist in a non-performance trade or occupation carried on for profit. In many cases such as in research this law is not enforced. Therefore a fully enforceable law is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Hundreds of thousands of children younger than 13 are employed in the UK in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy (ISBN1845298802). Child Employment Officers do not give them the protection they give children in performance work such as modelling & acting. Irrespective of the above Act the Officers do not regard them as being employed (NNCEE). This, and the lack of protection, undermines their rights as workers, and can result in them being mistreated & deprived of pay (ACAS).

attributes.action: Ensure that fireworks remain unrestricted to the general public.
attributes.background: A petition to ensure that the general public can (and in future will be able to) purchase fireworks for home displays without undue restrictions.

attributes.action: Remove the age limit from apprenticeships to help less experienced job seekers.
attributes.background: People age 24+ are very unlikely to find employment as an apprentice in many fields due to funding. We would like to change this so that apprenticeship vacancies no longer discriminate those in need of the training and experience required. We propose that the upper age limit be lifted.
attributes.additional_details:
Anyone older than age 24 should be given a fair chance to gain employment as an apprentice. There are many unemployed people lacking the necessary training and experience in their desired field. 

Employment should not be ageist. 

If raising the age limit is beyond the Government's funding ability, they can introduce an option to allow the apprentice to take out a loan for the funding which could then be payed back in a similar fashion to higher education / university degree loans.

attributes.action: Allow existing annuities to be transferred into another existing private pension
attributes.background: Government has cancelled previous intention to allow annuities to be sold.

attributes.action: Full pension rights for people thrown out  of the navy for living with ts person
attributes.background: Living with ts person was illegal back in 82, I was kicked out for this crime but I was 21 at the time and doing nothing wrong under cival law, now a days you get to stay in if you fall in love with a ts.I find it repugnent not to eben have had a simple sorry from the powers that be.

attributes.action: Increase the number of specialist road traffic officers to reduce road deaths
attributes.background: 10,732 people died on UK roads between 2010 and 2015. In the period Jan to March 2016 alone saw a 14% increase in reported road deaths. Without the fear of detection, non-compliance of road safety rules and laws is noticeably increasing. Enforcement is no longer supporting education or engineering
attributes.additional_details:
"The level of enforcement on our roads is woefully inadequate, 
between 2010 and 2014 the UK has seen a 27% reduction in the number of specialist road traffic police on the roads (falling from 5,338 to 3,901) outside of London". Brake-the road safety charity
Without a visible police presence, road users no longer fear being caught and are increasing non-compliant and yet detection rates are falling
Between 2010-15 133,565 people were seriously injured
Motor insurers paid out £27m per day in 2015

attributes.action: To change the laws on criminals being prosecuted on the account of rape.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the minimum jail sentence length and to rule out community service as a legitimate charge. Victims dealing with cases such as this deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Personally, I don't think that community service is an appropriate sentence for someone being convicted of rape. The victims and their families would have been put through hell and the perpetrator receiving community service for however long is basically letting them get away with it, when the victims deserve a lot more justice for the crime that was committed.

attributes.action: Public Debate and Referendum on Fracking (Shale Gas) in the UK
attributes.background:
Fracking is a controversial process to extract natural gas by fracturing surrounding rock and directly a high pressure mix to release the gas.

I ask for a referendum on whether fracking should be allowed in the UK at all.  Public opinion seems strongly against yet applications are being approved.
attributes.additional_details:
Fracking is once again in the media with the Government ruling that horizontal fracking can go ahead in Lancashire. It follows the approval of fracking at Kirby Misperton in May (although this is delayed to to legal challenges).

There is little consensus on the long term impacts on the area and the surrounding areas after fracking. Examples in the US have resulted in water contamination and air pollution causing headaches and nausea not to mention confirmation of causing earthquakes.

attributes.action: Justice for children. Tougher prison sentences for paedophiles, 15 years minimum
attributes.background: Paedophiles are protected by an out of date legal system. They are protected in prison and given a new identity once free. A paedophile or sex offender never truly faces their disgusting crimes, while the children and families have to deal with it forever.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophiles should be forced to mix with the general population of a prison - why should they be kept safe? A child will never be able to forget what they have been through, while the paedophiles are set free after a few years to do it to another child. How can parents protect their children from a paedophile when they are so well hidden?

attributes.action: Ban the sale of live Animals in all UK Pet Shops
attributes.background:
It's currently too easy for the general public to impulse buy pets many of which end up being sold, rehomed, surrendered to rescues 
The staff in the pet shops generally do not have the right skills or training for each animal.
All too often profit comes before welfare with many pet shops.
attributes.additional_details:
Many visits to a local (branded) pet shop, none of the staff show any trained skills of being able to deal with each animal 
not knowing how to handle a Budgie or get it out of the cage, 

Sending a Chicken back to the supplier for making "funny nosies" this chicken was going to be sent back to be put down, hanging air freshers in the cages of Rabbits and Chickens.

attributes.action: House of Lords/Commons respect the will of people and not stop Article 50
attributes.background: In June the UK voters voted to leave the EU; we were told the result would stand but each day pro EU politicians and supporters try to block our democratic voice. I propose we sign this petition to show the will of the people must be carried out no matter what. Teresa May can invoke Article 50
attributes.additional_details: Todays proposal from the House of Lords just proves the establishment think their views are more important than the 17,410,742 million who voted to leave the EU in a valid referendum.

attributes.action: Organise better system at Dartford Toll. Delays of at least 2 hours unacceptable
attributes.background: I have been using this route for over 30 years and never experienced the delays as I am now, since removing the tolls. Something MUST be dine
attributes.additional_details: It does not matter what time of the day I leave my home in East Sussex, I am delayed for at least 1 and half hours - why??

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ban packed lunches in schools and nurseries
attributes.background: Schools and nurseries in the UK have started to BAN packed lunches, some reasons for this include: Healthy eating and allergies. As parents, it should be a constitutional right to feed our own children.
attributes.additional_details:
I completely agree there should be a CLEAR packed lunch policy containing details of banned foods but to ban them all together is wrong. 

http://www.barnsleychronicle.com/article/parents-take-action-after-schools-packed-lunch-ban

http://www.spiked-online.com/newsite/article/banning-packed-lunches-a-slap-in-the-face-for-parents/15389#.V8CBAPkrKM8

attributes.action: Ban the sale of tobacco products in the UK
attributes.background: Tobacco products such as cigarettes kill 100,000 people around the  the UK in one year. It also harms many other people through second hand smoking. The life expectancy of a smoker is about 10 years less than a non smoker. Wouldn't it save many more lives if you banned the sale of tobacco products?
attributes.additional_details: http://patient.info/health/smoking-the-facts

attributes.action: To support a longer cease-fire in Syria to allow for food and medical aid
attributes.background: After the recent effects of the bombing in Aleppo, Syria, I would like to propose that we support a longer cease-fire to allow for key medical supplies to reach those who have been effected by War.
attributes.additional_details: In previous months the cease-fire has been only 48 hours, however this is too short a period of time for supplies to get to those who need it and to recover from the effects of injury, loss of home and even separation from loved ones.

attributes.action: Improve the morale of NHS working staff by reducing the disparity in wages
attributes.background: The morale of the working staff in the NHS is at an all time low ebb. So it's no surprise that they take little pleasure in going to work, and that enthusiasm is lacking. A committee is needed to balance the difference in wages and working conditions between the different tiers of the hierarchy.
attributes.additional_details: I have had firsthand experience in this matter, visiting hospitals once a month for the last 10 years for treatment. After speaking to numerous members of the nursing staff, it became apparent that a large majority were unhappy with the working conditions and the difference in pay between themselves and more senior doctors in the NHS. I wish for this matter to be discussed, and for the balancing of wages to be considered by a committee.
